New Records: Freddy Peralta pitched six scoreless innings
Key Match Events: William Contreras capped a five-run fifth inning with a two-run homer
Peralta struck out eight, allowed only two hits and walked three
Giants threatened in the sixth with a two-out single by Tyler Fitzgerald and a walk before Peralta struck out Heliot Ramos
Devin Williams bounced back from his first blown save last Wednesday at St. Louis with a 1-2-3 ninth for his sixth save in seven chances
Pre-Game Insights: San Francisco came in having won seven of the last 10 games at American Family Field and nine of the last 14 overall dating to 2019
Post-Match Reflections: The Giants spoiled the shutout bid with a run in the seventh and two more in the eighth
Milwaukee's Devin Williams bounced back from his first blown save last Wednesday at St. Louis with a 1-2-3 ninth for his sixth save in seven chances
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Giants threatened in the sixth with a two-out single by Tyler Fitzgerald and a walk before Peralta struck out Heliot Ramos
Patrick Bailey (right oblique strain) is with the club and could be activated from the 10-day injured list on Thursday
Hoby Milner (left shoulder impingement) looks to begin a rehab assignment Aug. 30 with High-A Wisconsin
